intro: Lawrencia helmsii, commonly known as the Helms' rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pungent scent. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Lawrencia helmsii is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and can withstand periods of drought.
